org.cougaar.util
Class PipedOutputStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.OutputStream
      org.cougaar.util.PipedOutputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable
public class PipedOutputStream
extends java.io.OutputStream

An efficient implementation of PipedOutputStream

Constructor Summary

          Create an unconnected PipedOutputStream.
PipedOutputStream(PipedInputStream pis)
          Create an PipedOutputStream connected to the given PipedInputStream.

Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

PipedOutputStream

public PipedOutputStream()
Create an unconnected PipedOutputStream. To be used this must be passed to a new PipedInputStream or a new PipedInputStream must be connected to this.

PipedOutputStream

public PipedOutputStream(PipedInputStream pis)
Create an PipedOutputStream connected to the given PipedInputStream. The pair of streams is immediately ready to be used if this constructor is used.

Parameters:
pis - the PipedInputStream to connect to this.
Method Detail

connect

public void connect(PipedInputStream pis)
Connect an PipedInputStream to this. This must be unconnected.

Parameters:
pis - the PipedInputStream to connect.

write

public void write(int b)
           throws java.io.IOException
Write a byte to the pipe. The byte is put into the connected PipedInputStream.

Specified by:
write in class java.io.OutputStream
Parameters:
b - the byte to put.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if this stream is closed or not connected or connected to a closed PipedInputStream.

write

public void write(byte[] b,
                  int off,
                  int len)
           throws java.io.IOException
Write an array of bytes to the pipe. All the bytes in the array are put into the connected PipedInputStream.

Overrides:
write in class java.io.OutputStream
Parameters:
b - the byte to put.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if this stream is closed or not connected or connected to a closed PipedInputStream.

write

public void write(byte[] b)
           throws java.io.IOException
Write part of an array of bytes to the pipe. Some of the bytes in the array are put into the connected PipedInputStream.

Overrides:
write in class java.io.OutputStream
Parameters:
b - the byte to put.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if this stream is closed or not connected or connected to a closed PipedInputStream.

flush

public void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
Insure that all bytes that have been written are accessible to the reader of the connected PipedInputStream.

Specified by:
flush in interface java.io.Flushable
Overrides:
flush in class java.io.OutputStream
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if this stream is closed or not connected.

close

public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
Close this stream. The connection PipedInputStream will signal EOF when all the bytes have been read.

Specified by:
close in interface java.io.Closeable
Overrides:
close in class java.io.OutputStream
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if this stream is already closed
